Detailed Description

NodeInfo stores local view (information) about a remote node The purpose of this class is to store the local view of the state of the remote node, the main connection point (url_peer) and the set of routes to this node. The state data field in NodeInfo structure indicates:

  • CREATED : the remote node info has been created and seems to be ok
  • SUSPECT : previous connected channel has been disconnected, last connexion failed or last write failed.
  • DELETED : a ghost has been completly declared to be dead.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Net::NodeInfo::State

State of a node

Enumerator:
S_VOID 

Initial state.

S_CREATED 

Creation of the remote node info structure.

S_SUSPECTED 

The node was detected has suspected because not responding.

S_FAILED 

The node is considered has failed.

S_DELETED 

Node was deleted.

const_iterator_route Net::NodeInfo::begin_route (  )  const

return the iterator over the first route to the node It is to the responsability of the caller to assure that the iteration is protected against concurrent modification of the set of node by locking the network object.
